definition: to be proficient in
to be versed in/to know well
cooked (of food)/ripe (of fruit)/mature (of seeds)/familiar/skilled/done/also pr. [shou2]

sentences.english: The politicians all claim they understand this.
sentences.chinese: 所有的政客都宣称谙熟此道。

sentences.english: John is smart and knows the business backwards, but people don't believe in him.
sentences.chinese: 约翰头脑灵活，谙熟业务，可就是不得人心。

sentences.english: More than 70 percent of management positions now demand computer literacy.
sentences.chinese: 超过7成的主管职务规定须谙熟电脑使用。

sentences.english: a supervisor in enterprise need to be familiar with running method.
sentences.chinese: 企业的管理者要谙熟经略之法。

sentences.english: They know the local culture and have multi-skill credentials.
sentences.chinese: 他们谙熟当地文化并且手握多种资格证书。

definition: to know sth fluently/well-versed
proficient (in sth)/to understand sth through and through
to be well aware of sth/to understand clearly
quite familiar with sth
skillful in/proficient in/adept at
see 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
see 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
to be proficient in/to master (a subject)
to read and re-read sth until one is familiar with it
to understand profoundly/well-versed/skillful/practiced/to have the knack
clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
to know sth like the back of one's hand (idiom)/to know (a person, a place etc) inside out
variant of 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
conversant/skilled/proficient
to read intensively
lit. ripe as a melon that rolls from its vine (idiom); fig. to know fluently/to know sth inside out/to know sth by heart
such matters/things like this/this line of work/this pursuit/this hobby/this endeavor
to clearly understand
